lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Welcome to Critical Role, where a bunch of us nerdy-ass voice actors sit around and play Dungeons & Dragons.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Dungeons & Dragons!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Travis is in a good mood. Glad you guys can join us. Before we jump into tonight's episode, let's get through some quick announcements. First and foremost, we have our first sponsor for the evening: our recurring friends at the wondrous D&D Beyond. Sam, you said you were prepared in advance for this one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Here's just a few. I'm just going to rifle through my files. This one's terrible. It was a pirate one, I was going to wear an eye patch, and go, "Ahoy and welcome to D&D be-yarrrgh! Grab your "duffel, set the binnacle and follow the freebooters to DnD beyond dot carrrrrrm!" But it didn't make sense.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, that's terrible.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This one was-- I was going to do a Travis impression.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "Yo bros, how about that Cowboys game, right? When Prescott hit Hurns on that outside post-route?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hurns doesn't play for them yet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Fuck. "I nearly spilled my Natty Lite all over my Emmitt Smith commemorative Snuggie."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's a Troy Aikman Snuggie!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I thought that was a little too dark.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This one? What was this one? Our tests indicate that your rash has spread to the groin ar-- Nope, that's not it. That was a different file. I had this one, this one's really conceptual. Here, I'll do it. Matt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Matt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Matt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Matt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's all it says. It just keeps going and saying Matt. It wouldn't have worked! This is why it's rejected! Oh, this one. This one is specific for--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Very Tim and Eric of you, I respect that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're all excited to meet Laura and Travis's baby.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So I consulted with some computer whizzes. We did some facial recognition to find out what their baby might look like.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Please tell me this is true.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, what did you do?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's got Travis's eyes, Laura's eyebrows, and why don't you just feast your eyes?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh jeez.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: On this beauty.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That is so terrifying.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That is some Planet of the Apes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It looks like a ferengi from Star Trek.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It is definitely your mouth. That's Travis's beard.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's like just the chin strap part. That's really Abe Lincoln of me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Then the other one I had was flowers for you to say sorry for that last bit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Aww, they're wonderful. They're real!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The other things in here were just the pictures that I cut out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh jeez, that's all--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I like that one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is the final one. There's more rejected ones, but I'll read you those another day.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There we go.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: BB! I want shaved ice, BB!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I got my flask for tonight.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You asshole.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Anthony Kiedis! That's who that picture looked like! I had to remember his name. Show it again! It's Anthony Kiedis! I'm just saying!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, I can see it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The flowers are a little more bitter right now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, it is.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Look look look!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's Anthony Kiedis.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you, Sam. Thank you, D&D Beyond.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What a look into the future. And what a bright future at that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Our second sponsor for the night actually comes from inside the family. Those of you who are familiar with our first campaign got to see him performing as Garthok for one of our guest episodes, and he's been on a number of shows here at Geek & Sundry. He helped write the theme song for Critical Role. Actually, he wrote the theme song for our show, amongst many other songs for the series. Jason Charles Miller has a new album coming out this week called In the Wasteland.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's amazing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's available now. You can find it wherever else music is streamed or sold; you can buy an autographed physical CD copy of it from Jason's website, which is jasoncharlesmiller.com. If you like rock, country or metal music, anything in between, you'll probably like this album. If you've ever heard his previous work, it's pretty badass actually. I'm very picky with my music and his stuff is great so check it out, I hope you like it. We have a great little video at the break also to discuss this fantastic album. So thank you, Jason, and I hope you guys enjoy his new stuff. Moving on. We made the really exciting announcement earlier this week. If you haven't seen: we launched our new online store and we're working on brand new shows for our YouTube and Twitch channel.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are none of us wearing the new shirt?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh wow.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Shit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (with mouth full of food) I'll put it on at the break. I've got it right here. I'll put it on when we get to the break. I'll put it on.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wow.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Gobble Gobble.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Keep going, Matt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We have also put up on Critrole.com shop the new Mighty Nein shirt. It's already selling out really fast in a lot of sizes, but we already have more ordered that are coming in, so we'll update you guys as soon as those come in.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Only small, medium and 4XL are sold out right now. Everything else is still in there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Super stoked about that. Also, wanted to let you guys know friends of ours in the community, I know that some of you guys are familiar with Web DM they do fantastic work, fantastic streams and they're doing, on June 24th at 1:00pm Central Time, this weekend, a fantastic fundraiser D&D stream. With a wonderful all-female cast: we have Satine Phoenix, Lysa Chen, Autumn Umphress, Syd Shields and the DM Emma Lambert will be running for the benefit of The Girls Empowerment Network in Texas. Tune in at twitch.tv/webdm or twitch.tv/criticalrole. We'll be hosting them as well so you can check it out. It's going to be a wonderful game with good people involved and a great charitable event that you can help be a part of the cause. So look forward to that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Not to be confused with WebMD.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. The standard editions of Vox Machina: Origins, the comic, are still available through Geek & Sundry and Alpha online shops. Details are at critrole.com. Talks Machina is every Tuesday evening at 7:00PM Pacific where our fantastic host Brian W. Foster talks about the episode that's happening tonight next week. Watch us next week and a few of us will be there, present, to discuss what will transpire. I believe that is it and that is all for the announcements. Anything else guys or shall we--?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Short and sweet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hello everyone, and welcome back. That's good. Last we left off: The Mighty Nein had completed their first of two ventures they agreed to complete in the name of The Gentleman. Heading northward towards Berleben, traversing the dangerous Labenda Swamp, freeing the once endangered safe house from the encroaching merrow dangers that had destroyed and decimated the people that were working there at the time and freeing it up for future use. You had acquired a bird friend in the tiny Kiri that is along with you, dagger in hand.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Six hit points.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. That's fine. You'll be fine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She's going to die.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You gathered your things and went back to the open road where you headed to the crossroads, did some trading. Through the evening, jumped into a few old friends who were looking to rob you, sent them on their way. Then continued northward until eventually you came upon the outskirts of the-- what was it-- Silberquel Ridge-- there we go, brain not working-- to the gnomish city of Hupperdook. Upon arriving in the city, you took in the industrial sites: the elements of it that are heavy machinery and the creation of new types of clockwork-based technologies, the stacks of soot and steam sent outward, the war machines being developed for use to the eastern lines where the conflict with Xhorhas is now brewing. You made a friend by the name of Rissa who said, in exchange for a round drinks in the evening, would show you around the town for a bit. Upon making your way to the upper level, you were given a brief tour of the vicinity which seemed strangely empty. The streets very well decorated for some seeming celebration, but nobody present. As the sun slowly went down, the town came to life as all the work whistles blew, the sounds of merriment began. And suddenly, as the sun goes vanishing behind the distant mountains, the golds and oranges and subtle purples of the sunset begin to take over, the sound of music and laughter begins to take the streets. So, Mighty Nein, what would you like to do?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Laughter and music? I don't trust laughter and music.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Were we on our way to something? Were we going to some place?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The Blushing Tankard? Is that where we were going?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Blushing Tankard, is that a place to stay?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was a tavern. Rissa?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right, yeah?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's a big party happening now!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Like I said, welcome to Hupperdook."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wha-- Should we-- Should we party?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, I mean, what else is there to do for the night here but that?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We don't know. We just got here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There's nothing else to do! You've arrived, go and get your stuff somewhere and let's have a drink!"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's go get out stuff somewhere.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You owe me a round anyway."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is this every night or just-- It is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah. It's part of our culture, our gnomish heritage."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Why? Because it keeps us working hard every day. Sure, maybe our general longevity, for "gnomes, is a little shorter than most, but what a life we lead." She reaches out and she's leaning out the cart as you guys are heading through the street. These kids run by with sparklers in their hands and she reaches out and plucks them from their hand and picks it up it's all (popping) around and she passes it over.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh what-- (yelling and blowing)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, it's cool!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, are you drawing something? It's a dick.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasping)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I knew it!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I was going to write dick!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, you didn't even need to.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I didn't!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I can already see I'm going to like you folks!"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wow. Work hard, play hard.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's the way we do here."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I like this town.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Should we drop our shit off and--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Where are we dropping? Can we stay at this place as well or do we--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You can."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Give me that! I want to smell it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Quick question. This Blushing Tankard tavern, the doors lock, right? There's privacy, it's not like some fucking free-for-all all night, is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, in the tavern."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Upstairs, in the rooms, I assume they have--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, you can lock the doors!"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm just asking. I don't know! Could be free love and a bunch of crazy people roaming around, I don't know!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It is called the Blushing Tankard.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why is it blushing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Because you put your lips to it."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, shit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Because why?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Because you put your lips to it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. We're in for a fucki-- Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Lead the way!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do I see anyone selling glow sticks?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Light up swords.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fiber optic whips.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I want a fiber optic whip.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Candy necklaces, big giant pacifiers.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's not great. Nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What you see is waves of fast moving families and people. Gnomish, some dwarves, a few human-sized folks rushing by. It looks like some of them are rushing from work to get home to disrobe from all their dirty clothes and jump back out with their party attire, or they're already on their way to wherever their destination is. You hear fireworks going off in the distance and the occasional flashes in the sky. But you don't see any vendors at this juncture. At this point, who's helming the cart and the horses?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fjord.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I am.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Tug to the right and it's got about two blocks down that way. It's going to be hard to miss. Look "for the large arch with the various spiraling ivy vines against it."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Very nice of you. Can I keep an eye on her hands just to make sure she's not going through my pockets while she's up here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, make a perception check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: During this travel, as you're keeping an eye out, she seems to be just focused on the task at hand.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I feel a little guilty, but not much.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That means that her sleight of hand is better than your perception. That's all it means.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Rissa reaches and tugs your hands to the left to gear the cart in that direction and goes, "All "right, Blushing Tankard right up this way." There's more laughter and there are two vendors now on the outside, one of which is currently selling flower necklaces or bands. The other has clusters of sparklers and firecrackers.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's some of them now. Am I stopping?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just keep it going, I'm just going to-- and I just roll off.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll follow.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Beau, get me some too, Beau! Get me some, too.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, I go up to the sparklers and firecrackers.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You walk up, and there's a young gnomish man in what would be the equivalent of his late teens, or early twenties, got a very prominent Adam's apple, and very thin for some of the gnomes you've seen around there. He glances up to you, holding a small barrel filled with various small-scale explosives. "Hi, can I help you?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I want three of everything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Three, all right. I'll just get this together."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How much comes in a pack?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, do you want three of everything, or do you want a pack?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They come in packs?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're going to lose a finger before the night's done.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did you just change your shirt, Travis?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, bitch.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How did that happen?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hocus pocus, motherfucker.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sorry, focus!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Packs of ten."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ten? Ten sparklers or ten poppers?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Packs for both of ten."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I want one of each. Pack of each.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right, pack of each. That will be five silver."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, thank you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I slow down just a little bit and give her time.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't think she's coming.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Then I also get a flower necklace for Jester.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh that's--" on the other side, the next person over there, a portly-looking fellow in his middle ages or so, resting inside of his neck, rescinded inside. "Hi, yeah, the flowers are going to run about five copper per string. So do you want just one?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll, ah--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Bring him with us!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's got a bunch of them tied up in his hair and hanging off his neck.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you also do braids?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Braids are across the way over there. Cindy does the braids."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll just take one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right, that's five copper, thank you."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Please tell me he has a shortsword and can fight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're going to keep collecting pathetic characters to fight with you?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes, please, bring Kiri and that guy I'll be happy every fight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's the best front line you can hope for.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I catch up, and I give Jester the flower necklace.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: As she starts to roll up I go: Hyah! And just take off.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (grunting)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, no I'm get-- (grunting) Is that for me? Beau, its beautiful!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It looked like you. I'm sorry if it smells weird.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's beautiful!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I take out one of the poppers, and I throw it! On the ground, what happens?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (bouncing)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Shit! I jump out, and I go pick it up, it's too valuable. I run back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You go back and look at it, and you realize there is actually a tiny little fuse on it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, there's a process, okay. I jump back on. Caleb, light it!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, you throw it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay! Oh, like skeet shooting!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, throw it in the air.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay! (whoosh)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Fire Bolt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll for an attack.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Fire Bolt?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It incinerates the fiber.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Pretty good. That's 19 plus something.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't even have to roll damage. She tosses it in the air and it arcs, this tiny little firecracker, this little gray rod and then this little streak of flame fires up and hits it. It detonates with this loud pop! sound and you see sparks around it. It dissipates a moment after and in the vicinity, about seven or eight nearby gnomes, two of which children, all go, "(gasp) "Yeah!" Start clapping and cheering.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You see that? I'm their hero.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How did you do it?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, different fingers, but sure. I like it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This is amazing, these could be useful.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: For shits and giggles or what do you have in mind?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: For distractions. We could do that again and like when we're fighting people--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Diversions.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sure, it went very good in the swamp with that little one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well. Can I have one to examine?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Say no.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You have a bunch of them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How many is in a pack?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ten, so you have nine now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I might have to get more before we leave this town.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think that's smart.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Matt, how much do we know about black powder?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, communally, not much at all. You, make an intelligence check and have advantage because of your alchemical history.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Intelligence?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You know it's had minor applications for a while, but it's only really been applied in very condensed and common use for, like the explosives you found in the mine, clearing out spaces in underground caverns, or for the detonation of localized rocks that are in the way of paths trying to be put in mountain ranges. Small scale black powder like this you haven't encountered, really, so this seems to be a relatively new use of this particular compound.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Up to this point, it's been rare that I or we've come across anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've barely come across it at all. You've read about it. Actually, the dynamite sticks you found in the mine were probably the first ones you encountered in your experience. Not a lot of use for it in the small farming town of Felderwin.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Would I have seen fireworks before in Nicodranas?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have before, but they're saved for very rare occasions, like the coming of a ship that's been long gone from shore or particular times of the year for celebrations they would go off and for that in particular they would put ship barges out on the water and they would fire them up from the waterfront. Having it this close is intense and even that small burst right there, there was a flash of heat that you haven't really had before and it's really exciting.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are we just in an ocean of gnomes; is it like 98% gnomes all around us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've seen a handful of dwarves, that's the next prominent people that live here and then a smattering of human and half-elf. Right now, you guys have just come to the outside of The Blushing Tankard.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm traveling with my hood up, minor detail, as you were.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's go inside!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, we're here. Is there a hitching post in the front?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah! Hitch up the horses.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You think it's safe? I don't think it's safe.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They seem real jovial-like.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: When people have libations they get up to hijinks at night, and that seems like the main activity here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You want to go in and secure us some rooms, and I'll watch the carriage. Figure out if there's somewhere else we need to keep it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I pull out the silver thread and I start going around the horses.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh! Or that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey Nott, have you ever been dancing before?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Have I ever been dancing before? Like to a place like this?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I've danced.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, just making sure.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why, are we dancing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I figure we're going to dance tonight.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Probably inevitably.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. I might need some liquor.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys, leaving Caleb and-- you're staying with Caleb while he sets up the perimeter.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, while he does the string.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do we need to choreograph something?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasps) We probably should. We should probably get Kiri involved.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That sounds adorable.

lines.name: LAURA

lines.text: Definitely going to need a drink for this.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're going to lose her tonight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys enter the Blushing Tankard Tavern, it is one of the larger taverns you've been in. The floor space has 20 or so round tables scattered amongst the floor. There is a stage in the far back where the music hasn't quite started yet, but there are musicians setting up. You can see a violinist who's currently tuning. There is a piano in the back, and outside a couple of taverns you saw in Zadash, and your experiences from when you were on the coast, pianos aren't as common in tavern spaces. Usually reserved for the upper class, for private performances or higher-end social events. However, the tables are filling up already, people are rushing in there. Food is passed around left and right. In the back, there's a group of gnomes that are currently clapping the ground on their table, singing some sort of tune, a shanty. One of them is up on the table, clapping his legs there. One of the barmaids comes by and slaps him. "Get off the table!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This place is great!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's really nice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What would you guys like to do?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Try to get some rooms.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's get some rooms and stow our stuff and get out there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to go try to play the piano.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Right away?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you play the piano?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I've played it a little bit at home.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I want to listen. I'm going to sit close by.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Molly and I will go.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have a lot of really good songs that I learned when I was growing up. I'm going to sit down and try to play Chopsticks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, go ahead and make a performance check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh yeah, it's an eight!

lines.name: MATT, LAURA
lines.text: (poorly playing Chopsticks)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You turn over your left shoulder and there is a half-elven gentlemen in a very nice doublet, who is currently holding a handful of sheet music. "Um, you're at my piano."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (poorly playing Chopsticks)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He twitches at the off-tune hammering of the keys. "I'll be right back." He turns around and wanders off for the moment, clearing his ear with his pinky. You guys go to get rooms?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You haven't quite caught their eye yet, they're in the midst of other business.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you say she was a dwarf?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A dwarf, yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Who do we talk to? Do we talk to the gnome or the dwarf?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Whichever one we catch the eye of first.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, we should do the bar lean in thing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right, I'm in.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Shove some other people around, do that thing.

lines.text: For the hell of it, both of you guys roll charisma checks, please.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, this is going to be funny.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Something we're great at. Just straight checks?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just roll a d20 and add your charisma modifier.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That dice just is the biggest tease.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Want to go at the same time?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It rocks back and forth. Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Three, two, one. Six.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You're a bit higher than the usual folk. What can I do for you?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And some drinks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Both of those can be done, lassie."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How many rooms do we need? Three, four?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (counting)

lines.name: MARISHA, TALIESIN
lines.text: Four.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's one gold piece per room per night."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I just put down four gold pieces.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does it come with amenities? Does it have a mini bar? Do you charge?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This is the mini bar, my dear. But don't worry. We can bring drinks up, we can bring "companions up, we can bring what you need up, just let us know."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're in a tourist town; things are going to cost something.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right.

lines.text: All right.

lines.text: (playing The Entertainer)

lines.name: SAM, LAURA
lines.text: (speedily playing The Entertainer)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right as she starts crescendoing, about to get to the quiet part (speedily playing The Entertainer), a hand slams down on the keys, and that same half-elven gentlemen leans in once more and goes, "If I might please request my instrument returned to me, my dear."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is a really good piano.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Thank you."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You should be really proud it's yours.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I am."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you have a tip jar?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I have a tipping hat." He pulls off from the side this wide-brimmed hat that comes to a point in the front and floppy in the back, and he sets it up on top of the piano.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I really think the first couple tips should be to me because I really set up the room for you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well then, I certainly hope the first few tips come while you're at the bench."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fabulous.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And he sits down at the bench and pushes you off of it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I toss one gold in and say: This one's for the lady. Very good.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you see?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I saw." Cracks his knuckles, sets his music down in front, starts getting ready. The other performers to the side are watching this out of the corner of their eye and laughing. They're enjoying the tension that's brewing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I run over and give Caleb a kiss on the cheek. Thank you, Caleb.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys get your rooms situated. As the keys are being passed out to the different rooms, drinks are being handled. "So are you looking for something strong or something strong?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Amaze me, baffle me, make me forget where I am.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're colorful."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Bless you. You're colorful yourself. I love everything you're wearing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Thank you. First one's on me, how about that?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Bless you. I'll happily pay for hers as well because I want to drink her under the fucking table.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Hold that till later on. That event's not till later tonight."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What happens later tonight? Other than more drink.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Is this your first time here?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Are we that obvious?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "A bit. Well, we have some performances going on, and then we have our contest. Our weekly "Hour of Honor. So just don't drink too much if you're looking to compete." She pops the top button off the top of her blouse and gives a better look at her dwarven cleavage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I love that you did it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Brava!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I realized that I could do it as I was doing it. As she does that, she reaches down and pulls out a dark red glass bottle with a large cap, which she pulls off. This tiny glass, passes it over to you, and you look at it. You're used to seeing liquid splash quite often, this sloshes at a slower pace. It's a thicker liquor.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I dip a finger.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's surprisingly sweet. Strong, the burn kicks in afterward. You like it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Shoot or sip?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's up to you."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry to interrupt your incessant flirting. Can I please have a damn drink?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Would you like one of the same?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, one of the same, yes!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right, that'll be five silver pieces."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I thought he paid for me; I thought you paid for me.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I am paying for you. I just put a gold down. Keep the tip as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh my goodness, thank you!" She puts it in her cleavage. Pours you another shot of it as well, hands it over.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I just kill the whole thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, it burns, but it's good. It's like a sweet thick honey liquor that coats the throat, and the coating at first feels nice until the burn hits.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's kind of medicinal.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Challenge accepted. (satisfied grunt)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's good.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Caleb and I have come in at this point and I turn to Caleb and go: I feel like I may be regretting my roommate choice tonight. It's just a hunch. I think he's in his element.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, the odds are that you are not going to even see him in your room tonight, so I wouldn't worry about it so much.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You think? He'll just like tear into the night and maybe not come back until the sun comes up?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's like a coyote. You know what that is?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, it's like--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wow. Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I do.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, they like to fuck a lot is my point.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I thought those were rabbits.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I thought so, too.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're going to have to work on our analogies, I feel like there is something missing here. Yeah, okay, a bunny coyote.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That sounds cute.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It does sound cute.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's probably not as raucous a room, but you're welcome to it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, just in case he goes full monty, I might have like a secret knock or something.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where did Yasha go?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yasha is with you, but the player's in Japan, filming. As you glance around, Yasha's sitting towards the back, and towering over most of the clientele here, and not necessarily uncomfortable, but unsure what to make of the jovial atmosphere. There is the faint corner of a smile, but the awkward, anxious smile of not knowing what to do and afraid to step any direction and crush somebody.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: She's turning on the charm.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fair enough, I appreciate that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There are four rooms.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I really like it when she crosses her arms like that, it makes her biceps look good.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So Molly can have a room all to his own, if he really wants to, you know (clicking) (whistle).

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, are we talking about that, I'm not going to invade your space if you don't need it, don't worry about it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, I mean half of me's interested, the other half's terrified, so I'm just kind of curious.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And if you drink enough, you won't remember either way.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Not in my bar!"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know, I've never seen anyone actually swing from a chandelier. I just thought it was a metaphor.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, that's entirely something you can do. It's more common than you'd think.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it allowed in other bars?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you talking to Rissa? "I imagine if they're not paying attention."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There was some pub. I don't remember what town I was in, but I do remember the pub because it was actually called the Swinging Chandelier. I don't remember what town it was, though. But it was a great pub. It had the best chandelier.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "My gnomish eyes spot what looks to be one open table across the way, right there." Rissa points, and you can see, past the way, there's one table that two people are just getting up from and leaving.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will dart at full speed, full dash to get that table.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Might buy you an hour before it breaks."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to walk right into the middle of this. Gentle persons, are you harassing our employee right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They both look wildly confused. "No, no."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We have employed the services of this person right here, and I would agree that you should probably leave right now and get another table for yourselves.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an intimidation check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nope, that's a four.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, someone's starting early, not too bad. No, "from what I've heard about these folks, their blood's fire, but on the inside they're nothing but cold and clammy." He goes and flicks the edge of your nose, these two little gnomish punks.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (demonic voice)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I use my tail to--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If you want to go, too, at the same time. I say a little bit of Infernal, and I'm going to use a blood maledict and make him go blind for a second.

lines.name: LAURA

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, which one?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll do the other one.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The one on the left for me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The one that just flicked you in the nose, his eyes go black and you can see the bit of crimson pooling at the corner of the eyes. He goes, (stuttering), stumbles back, and hits the stool, and falls onto his ass. "What's going on?!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to jump on top of him and start rifling through his pockets.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you. I was hoping for it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make a sleight of hand check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The table, Sam, the table!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You manage to pull six silver pieces and three gold pieces out of his pocket.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Anything other than money?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right now, no. Strangely enough, it's only money, and only that amount.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm watching Nott, and as soon as I see that she has found everything that she is looking for, I've got the copper wire ready, and I mutter through it, to the one on the ground: They're going to kill you. You have to run, now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The one that gets slapped in the ass by Jester is like, (stuttering) "I apologize. Rissa, "we didn't know," reaches over and goes and grabs the friend. As soon as Nott jumps on and starts thrashing around on him, "Get that thing--" goes and pushes you off of its body, picks up the other gnome. At this point, his eyes come back, and the little strings of blood are curling down the side of his cheek. He goes, "What happened?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's really embarrassing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's sad, really.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They both just get lost into the crowd.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, stay, play with us longer!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Rissa looks over her shoulder at them leave and (laughing).

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wow, that took a turn fast.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I like the way that worked out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Me too, indeed!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Who were they?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Fitz and Ashton. They're both a couple of punks. I've known them since I was a kid."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They called you "Tabletop."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, Tinkertop."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Tinkertop.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Both equally mysterious.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait. So your dad is, what, rich or something?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's nothing to be ashamed of. It's okay if he is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's had a rough few years."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He said he was brain-sick.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's just him being an arsehole."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What kind of stuff does he make?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All sorts of things, toys, contraptions, occasionally whatever he's told to make by the "Starosta, but he's just a bumbling twat, really."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we meet him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Tomorrow, maybe?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I bring over a round of drinks for everybody.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Another round of just traditional ale drinks for everybody would probably run you, we'll say three silver pieces. As you guys gather around for a second, Rissa livens up a bit after that conversation. "But anyway, you've asked me a bit about myself, what about you? What are you here "for? What brings you to this godforsaken place?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're actually here for a spot of work.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Looking for work?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, of course, work, that's what we're doing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not looking for work, we're just on a job.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I said for a spot of work.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We have been fascinated with it for quite some time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's not the first time we've heard that."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I was really hoping you would have houses of mushrooms. Do you have any?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm just going to call that unintentional ignorance, but, no, gnomes don't live in "mushrooms. Don't be saying that around here very loudly, not all folks will be taking kindly to that."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She's set in her ways.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, I just thought Hupperdook sounded like a mushroom sort of town.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Didn't she just say not to--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to stop, though.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They prefer the term "toadstools."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I somehow feel like that's worse.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She grabs one of the tankards and starts drinking heavily from it. "Anyway!" The music begins to kick in even louder. The celebration has kicked into a second gear here, once I can find the music transition.

lines.name: MARISHA, TRAVIS
lines.text: (heavy metal guitar melodies)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, so it's the Noise Room. (heavy bass thudding)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The pianist you met earlier is starting to make his music happen. It's beautiful and echoes through the room, the placement of it. You get the sense now, whether it be some enchantment or some intentional acoustic presence in the room, but the music carries well and seems to bleed from everywhere. As the dancers are up on the tables, these silk scarves rainbow-colored, from their arms, twirl into large circles and shapes, and they have this worked out, fantastic choreography in unison. They begin to leap from tabletop to tabletop in a circular fashion, making these large arching foot leaps and landing again. Folks cheer with each land, the music whirring itself into a frenzy. Folks are starting to toss coins towards them on the table. They, in the middle of it, will spin, catch one and pocket it and move back into the dance. You get the sense this a very practiced and fairly often performed as to how well-oiled this machine of a performance is.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They are almost as nimble as you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I toss a silver.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Snatched out of the air.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I toss two at the same time.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I see if I catch one. Missile Snare. I'm going to try to catch one of Molly's coins.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did you just take a dancer's tip?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a dexterity check. This is going to be a contested dexterity check between you and a dancer.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, I'm into it. Especially if it fails, please!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Natural one.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's justice.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you reach for the coin, your fingers almost touch it before everything goes dark as a wooden shoe-covered foot (slamming) across your face from the dancer who catches it between two fingers, looks down, retracts the foot, and as you get your vision back and look up, the dancer gives you a wink and goes back into a spin.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I wink back. You know, I kind of liked that. It was kind of hot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (applause)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hot damn!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The dancers smile and step off, walking around with hats in the front, taking tips from people at tables as they adjust the tables back to their original point. Everyone else goes back to their meals, and you see them tossing the odd copper or silver piece into their hats.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know if we can learn that dance.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think we can do it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's just work on something simple. We're going to take a moment to work out a couple of moves in case it comes up. Just some basic hand moves.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Kiri is off to the side. (chirping)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We can have her stand on one shoulder each--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm much shorter than you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll be on my knees. Then we can do these things. Kiri can have a ribbon, and she'll do this while we do it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I like it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's basically the same as what they just did.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Caleb maybe can do some special effects.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Will it be dark where we are doing this? I worry about-- you know what I worry about.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe I should sit it out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, it just depends on the situation. This happens all over the city, outside, everywhere, ja?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "For the most part, yeah. As the evening goes on it tends to gather around the places where "drink is running freely, until everyone passes out, then wakes up, hair of the dog, usually takes "himself a bit of Fuse and then gets back to work."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: A bit of Fuse?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "A Fuse is the hair of the dog drink that we brew here to get everyone waking up and back to work."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I know what Molly'll be having in a couple hours.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't know how it's going to mingle well with non-gnomish tracts, but I'm willing to watch and try."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm very excited to find out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Me too." (laughs)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Rissa, can I ask you about the-- what's it called-- honor hour that comes up later?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Hour of Honor?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hour of Honor, yeah. What's that about?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Whoever provides the most monetary amount to the challenge gets to go one-on-one with their team, "drink to drink, until only one's left un-puking or un-passed out."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A team drinking competition?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The remainder gets the coin, I think a percentage goes to the house and gets to take the "title and a token. That token is worth a free drink to each member of that team in this bar "every night."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Every night?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm sorry. It is almost like a CrossFit gym.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There you go.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should probably do that. For this, I would make an exception.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It could cost a lot of money.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How much?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, he said whoever contributes the most monetarily gets to take a shot at the honor.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How much do people usually contribute?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have two gold.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Some folks put up the few gold they've earned for a few days if they're feeling lucky. I've seen "people put upwards of 20, 25 gold sometimes, which is quite a sizable sum."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you a big drinker, Rissa?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I can hold my weight, but I'm not much of a competitor, if that's what you're asking."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is it happening relatively soon, or do we have a few more hours to explore a bit? I just have the feeling if we were to engage, that all activities after that would not be documented in the ol' brain so well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've probably been here for the better part of an hour or two, just getting your paces, having drinks and taking in the performances and the music. "I'd say you probably have another hour "before it begins."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Want to do a little runaround?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I figure, if we're going to do that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think we're going to do that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's go. Who's going to put Kiri either on their shoulders, or we need to--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: To bed!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We can't put her to bed!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why not?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Won't you, Kiri?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why would she come out of the room?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Because Hupperdook.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Because there's so much noise and stuff.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's family friendly.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's no drop-off daycare. Is there a daycare here, Rissa?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (like Jester) "I am Kiri."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, god.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, you are very sweet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (like Jester) "Yes, I am very sweet."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Perhaps our feathered friend is a little more important than the horses and I could leave my threads around her room and she would be safe there. I would know if there was a problem.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (like Caleb) "Doesn't matter, though."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, but it does matter, because you are a young child and you need to get your rest, and we are going to be doing things that are, quite frankly, not for your eyes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (like Jester) "Okay."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She would come out of the room. I know her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (like Jester) "I know her."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What if we get her one of those child leashes?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh! They said that they would send someone to the room, right, Molly?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Did they?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Didn't you say that they would send someone to the room?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We could get a babysitter.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Like a babysitter. You could pay one of their women to watch our little Kiri.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have done some ridiculous things in my life; that might take the top of it, though.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They're working women; we rent them for a time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Rissa, at this point, goes, "Well, first off, you're assuming they're all women."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh yeah, that's true! We could get a sturdy, strapping gigolo man to go up there and watch out for Kiri!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't think that's a bad idea.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Rissa, do you know how much one of these evening companions might run per hour?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I can honestly say I do not. Sorry."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Should I go ask?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll make my way up to the bar, to the one with the--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There is one member of our party who is probably not going to want to go out and see this ridiculousness.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She is a wallflower tonight.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She does seem very uncomfortable, yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I still want to check the price, so I go up to the bar.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you approach the bar, the dwarven woman, who's in the process of cleaning a spill on the side, looks over and sees you and does a triple-take, like-- "Well, would you look at this "strapping mass of green and tooth." (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thank you kindly, ma'am.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What can I do for you?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's a little early in the evening, but I thought I might get a head start and inquire what some friendship might run me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Mighty forward, but I can't say I'm not interested. I've got a few more hours on my shift, "but if you hang around--"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I would hate to remove you from your duties. Plus, my companions are also interested in the same. You said there might be--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, it's been a while since I've--"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh! No, yeah, let me clarify. (stammering) I need--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She goes and starts pouring herself a drink.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Multiples-- not multiples! I need individual companions for my friends, not just your beautiful self.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "How many?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Three.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Three companions? All right. I have to go and connect with a friend here and see what's "available, but that's certainly doable."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Great, and do you know how much that might run?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, that depends on what you're asking for. Is it only for the hour, is it for the "evening, what the requests are--"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Per hour is good, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "For an hour? Three? That'd put you about, say, 20 gold."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Outstanding. I will be sure to return. I turn my head and leave.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What did she say?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That was the most horrible thing I've ever had to do. I'm not prepared to talk to people about those things.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What did she say?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's 20 gold for three people for an hour.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Three man-hours?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So that's-- yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are you all right?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: God, it's real uncomfortable.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why do we need three people to watch Kiri?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Look, I was just making shit up on the fly, all right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yasha, I know you're not into this. I know that you want to have a night out. Do you just want to sit and keep the young one out of trouble?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I can do that, yeah. She's small. I can hold her down."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's going to be fine. That's a joke.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are you sure? I was planning to go out, but it's awkward for me. I thought you would be going.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's awkward for me, too."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I thought that we could give each other moral support, you know what I mean?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll hold the bird down."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is that a phrase, or does she actually mean she'll hold the bird down?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Only one way to find out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think the child will be dead by the morning.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Kiri, are you cool with staying with Yasha for the whole night?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (like Jester) "I can send a message."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you promise you won't try to leave her, and you won't try to come out and find us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (like Jester) "Okay. I don't know if it's smart."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't think it is either, Kiri!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Jester, come on. She is just trying to tug on your heart strings. She'll be fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (chirping)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I just love her so much.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I know. She'll be safe.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You be good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She holds her little dagger in front of her.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll bring you back something, Yash.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Blade pointed down, Kiri. Good job.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (like Jester) "Okay."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There we go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Caleb, we may need a third person to join our dance now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's right. Now me and Caleb will do it. You stand on our shoulders. You wave the ribbon.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You could ask Beauregard. That's not going to happen.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can't dance? You're not a dancer?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Have you ever danced, Caleb?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasps) You have? I can't picture you dancing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He's never going to dance again.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (singing) He's never going to dance again.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There's too many dance puns!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You can dance if you want to.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's not going to leave his friends behind.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, that is the key: if I want to. No, perhaps Beauregard is fleet of foot. She could round you out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you sure?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But Caleb, we want to dance with you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fucking Pet Sematary up in this bitch.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I played with Mommy, and I played with Judd, and now I going to play with you. I will take a rain check on that. No thank you, Jester. It is tempting, but no.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We'll figure it out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I guess we can-- Beau?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah? No, I know, I'm your second choice--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're three.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're very dexterous and I think you'll be a very good dancer.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Feels like you had to reach for that. You stammered a little.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Plus, you have already lots of scarves on you, so you can do a lot of the things the people were doing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You got scarves on you?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I do have a lot of scarves.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, that's truthful. It's obvious how dexterous you are; you're just gruff.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah! So should we dance in the street?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We should rehearse. We don't know when we're going to need the dance yet.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going outside to see what this place has to offer before it's time for a drinking contest that we'll--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're going to need a beagle to lead the charge. I'm assuming that's you?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (shouting) Onward and outward!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Jesus. (dog baying)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you're making your way out, the dwarven lass reaches out in your direction, Fjord, to flag you down.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh! Ma'am.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "So, just asking: how soon are you wanting this companionship sent to your rooms, and--" and her finger's playing with the front of your armor on the edge of the bar, and goes, "I could give "you a discount."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (stammering)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You know, here's the thing. He's already been with the Ruby of the Sea, so probably nothing you do could compare to that. Kind of sad, really.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Would you like me to cancel your request, then?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, no. I'd like to put a deposit down. I don't know when we'll be back. Maybe four gold to hold the reservation?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ask if there's a cancellation fee.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, I can't. I'm terrified.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, hopefully see you around." Gives a hint of grinning stink-eye in your direction, Jester, and back to Fjord: "Take care of yourself, lad."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did you just put a hooker on layaway?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think I did. I feel like I did. Did you just say I'd been with your mom?!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know. As soon as I said it, it was really creepy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, that's fucked up!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But you know what? It was just a power play, and it didn't really work out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I will say, normally being like, "You slept with my mom" is an insult or something, or "Don't talk about my mom."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, but people that have slept with my mom are really rich and really powerful, usually, so it's a compliment for them.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: "Yes, and," not "no, but."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is good. You have an opportunity for later, if you choose to use it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I could sit in the room and let you know if they're any good or not!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are you honestly okay? You seem very perturbed.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm not real comfortable with this sort of stuff.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Have you ever been with someone?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, totally.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you sure?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Insight check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's pretty good.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. He seems to be telling the truth.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe not many, though.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Have you ever paid for anybody before?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Like Captain America, not many?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep. Pretty close.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Frozen in ice, man. It'll happen.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Was it someone special?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, Kiri, who's not that far from you because you're still in the bar, says (like Jester) "Don't eat humans, okay?" Yasha goes, "I'm going to take her upstairs," and heads off to the chamber.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm going to let you guys take the lead on this. I'm more of a spectator, at this point.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: With the hooker?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, I thought we were going out for an hour!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry, you jumped conversations. You have to specify.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thought we were going to warm up into this thing!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: With the hooker?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, we're going out for a bit, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why did you give them money, though?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a big, bassy (impact) that you can feel in your chest. There's a flash of color outside, and there, out maybe 20 feet, looking up, Molly. There's a flash of the firework in the sky going across his horns and form.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (maniacal laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, jesus. It begins.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, let's go make the rounds.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You walk out in this fair. Most people who have gathered here, they're sitting there, they're eating food, and they're watching the fireworks as they go off. There's a few folks out there, candle dancers, they have these light candles, and it's this very slow, meticulous dance. They're moving in the darkest places of the corner and give this almost will-o'-wisp-type performance. It's really enchanting, and borderline creepy at times, when you can't actually make out the forms of the dancer in the shadow. People are watching and keeping an intent look on it. Otherwise, the rest of this thoroughfare is apparently here, though you're not sure how much businesses are open, since most people are in the process of recovering from a day of business. What do you want to do?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Predictably, I would like, as I follow this group around, to keep one eye open for a bookstore.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The nerdiest raver.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can we get you a card, and hold it up? Bookstore.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It needs dónde está la biblioteca?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What else are you guys going to do?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm looking for vendors. I'm looking for things that are amusing. Bright lights, colors.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If there's any more of those sparklers or poppers around--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, yeah. There aren't a lot of them, meaning there's not an endless supply, but you go back to the same people that are just up the road to the right from the outside of the tavern. You can find the same two vendors you spoke with earlier.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You want to buy them out real fast? Let's go!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Steal some?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We can just pay for it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You said there were silk flowers? There's fake flowers? I want to see if I can find the best looking-- that New Orleans, Halloween night, crazy beautiful, overproduced--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check, and you make a perception check, Caleb.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (blows a raspberry) Goddamn it! No.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That is not the Snitch. Just because it's gold, doesn't mean it's a Snitch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Was it a natural one?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That was a two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, so not quite a natural one. You come upon a number of vendors that have already given out all their flowers, so you're having a hard time finding anybody that still have any for sale in this main central area.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If anybody sees, I'm looking for silk flowers. Really, something nice. Something super fancy, if you see anything.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to look for flowers too, then!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll come to that in a little bit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I rolled a 19 for Buch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, good to keep that in mind as we move on.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We go pick up some more snappers and poppers, poppers and snappers.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You go back to those two vendors. They're both set up on the side. The one guy with the sparklers is still set up there, and the guy with the fireworks is still resting there on the edge, and the other guy with the flowers is set up on the side. There's one guy with the sparklers and the fireworks who's there, the thin, somewhat dopey-looking, young gnomish guy, and you have the flower vendor, who's slowly settled into himself, like a barrel of a gnome.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nott, the flower guy's creepy. Just felt like throwing that out there before we approach.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. All right, thank you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I go up to the snapper and popper guys.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Hey! Welcome back."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Need more packs.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No. I want something more powerful.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Plus all the packs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't really have anything more powerful than these."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Where do you find more powerful?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can you make something?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're arms dealing on fucking party night.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's, at this point, locking eyes with you, Nott, and there's like a look of recognition in his face.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Gulp.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't have anything of that variety. I'm sorry."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey, Nott, do you want to-- just stand by me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I swoop back into the shadows and mingle.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Narc.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey, don't-- why are your eyes wandering at her? What was that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Sorry, we're closing shop up for the night."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, give me your packs!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Then he goes and closes up his little satchel and walks away.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, you piece of shit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sorry, that was my fault.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey, don't ever apologize for who you are, man.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, I--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You can't help that shit, first off.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I should have known. I can't talk to people.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You can't predict when people are going to be shitty.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They're always shitty. It's a 100% accurate prediction.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's pretty-- that's a good point.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: By the way, Beau, thank you for the other day.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: When?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: For talking to Caleb through his, you know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, he's a good guy.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just be sensitive around him. I know that that's not your strong suit, but he doesn't deal well with harsh criticism all the time.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And you think you do?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm used to it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's true.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Tell me something, how did you know about this place?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hupperdook?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, how did you know that the gnomes here get down with the funky fresh rhythm all night?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You hear things.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What job?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I worked at a library, the Cobalt Soul library.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's a Cobalt Soul?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It is a faction of monks.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What kind of a faction of monks?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is Nott slurring her words?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you evil? Are you a bad guy?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, I hope not. I think it differs from day to day, depending on what I'm doing. Do you think I'm a bad guy?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't think so.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's all that matters, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But I don't know, you seem to know a lot about a lot of things and sketchy things, too.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That has to do with the job that I had before the job that I had.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What was that job? I thought you grew up-- didn't your parents make wine or something?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What was this about a job? Wait, little townsgirl, her parents are wine makers, now you're a brutal assassin martial artist who can kill anything. What happened in between those two things?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, there's definitely something missing, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's catch up with the others while we walk and talk.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: My dad was super protective and I was an asshole and rebelled a lot.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You? No!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. You know, so when interesting and different people would pass through my hometown I started making some connections, started getting involved in some mainly illegal trading.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Like what? What kind of stuff?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I got in really big trouble from my parents because I started syphoning his cases of wine and selling them underground for half the cost, without tariffs.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You were bootlegging your old man's hooch?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, I was.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Industrious.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. On top of other things, that was like my big denouement, you know? I don't know, I just grew to hate the town that I was in and the system that my father was a part of and so everything--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is he a bad person?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He wasn't a bad person. I think he just had bad direction. I don't know, he could've been a good dad. He was a shitty dad and a good businessman.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So you took matters into your own hands?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And got in trouble, and were sent off to boarding school?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, kind of.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: With monks who are librarians and taught you how to kill with your fists.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Then he found out about my smuggling scheme with his wine. One day, he called me down into the living room and there was a whole group of monks and people in black. I tried to fight them off and they grabbed me and they drug me away.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, this was not by choice? You were abducted by monks?!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: My dad paid to get me abducted by monks, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh my gosh.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He wasn't very proud.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you okay?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure. Great.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Was it hard?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. I mean, there were elements that were hard, but everyone has had hardships, right? What's it matter? Besides, he sent me off to the monks. I think he was hoping that they were going to beat my indiscretions out of me. Instead, I think all of the things that my father saw in me that he hated, the monks saw as a potential advantage. So, in a weird way, I think it might've been the nicest thing he ever did for me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I've never thought of you as an optimistic person, but that's a very positive way of looking at it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, I still never really want to see him again, and I don't think he wants to see me again, either. In fact, he told that he didn't want to see me again. So it's good. Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, you guys are caught up with the rest of the crowd as you guys have meandered your way and look up and you can see the rest of your party has been wandering the street.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But, I do have a nice little wineskin that I keep reserved, of my family's wine, if you want to taste.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I would. Very much.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I toss Nott the wine.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll just take a little sip, in case we have to do the Hour of Power later.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's pretty damn good wine.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow. That's amazing.

lines.name: MARISHA
