lines.text: Anybody else wants a sip of my heritage?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is that code for something?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's been many years.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, you should show me sometime, because I want to see it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am very much out of practice, and--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We can do it when nobody's watching, okay?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I could see you as a waltzer. That make sense.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It does. A little bit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm really good at the waltz.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I believe it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. They taught me the same time I learned piano.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is there anything else that you're hiding from us? Any other quirks or skills?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So many. Lots of skills.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What are three more?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can paint. I'm really good at baking scones. Specifically scones.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: With cinnamon, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: With cinnamon.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Scones are hard to make.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know. It's a very tough recipe, but I'm good at it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The trick is to not overmix. You don't want to overmix. Oh, sorry. We've been walking with your friend, Beau.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wait. Hold that thought. So that's two things.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And the third is?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The third thing is something that I want to talk to Fjord about. Because if he's that inexperienced, then maybe he should take some lessons or something.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh my god.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Time is of the essence. He might be with a lady of the night later tonight. You might have to teach him quickly.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's true.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And was that skill learned or innate?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Cram school.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No. It really was more of a learning sort of thing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, study is key.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes. It's all about studying.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's true.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this moment, Caleb, in listening to this conversation, your eyes focus on a sign post behind her on a building that reads Bent Binders.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm done here. I walk towards the store. Is it open?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. The windows are closed.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh my gosh. I press my nose to the glass and try to see what I can see. Is there a lot of books in there? Or just a few books? Or--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll go put my nose next to his nose on the glass. What are we looking for?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's a 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you look through, the combination of the two of you, eventually the glass fogs up and you can't see anything. But from the brief moment you had, on the inside, it looks like there are a few shelves that contains some books. It looks like there is actually a binding press and tools for bookbinding in there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: From what I can tell, does it look like a technical place where they are just making books or do they have books for sale?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks like they have books for sale, but it's too dark for you to see if they are blank or if they are actual books at the moment.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I cannot tell if it's a happy or a sad bookstore.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are there any silk flowers? I was looking for those.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: TALIESIN, LAURA
lines.text: Yay!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah. Tonight, when it doesn't matter, you roll great.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shut up. 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's standing there, smiling, and you can see an older gnome sitting in a rocking chair behind her with a big old pipe coming out of his mouth as the hat is half-covering his face and he's just sitting there, rocking next to her.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I hop over next to her. (gasps) I've been looking everywhere for you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Really?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Mm-hmm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Hi."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You have the best flowers I've ever seen and I would like to buy some.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, my goodness. Thank you so much. Okay."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How much is a flower?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Sorry, copper."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A copper apiece.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I will buy--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Copper."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I will buy ten flowers from you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Lickety-split." She goes and takes out a handful, counts them in your hand, "One, two--"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How old are you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "--three-- I am five."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You are five? That's wonderful. Does your dad take good care of you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes. He's a good dad."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you a good dad?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What number is that?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think that-- I don't know. I wasn't counting.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 13. That was 13.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You know, I happen to have a little girl with me who is very cool and I think she would like to play with you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Mm-hmm. She's extra special, though, so you'd have to be very nice to her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, I'm very special, too."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasps) Really?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where do you live? Because I could bring her over and you could play together tomorrow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The house is two buildings down that way and back one street. You could see it has the red "brick on the base, by the door."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Red brick on the base by door. I'll come see you guys tomorrow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay. What's your name?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: My name is Jester. What's your name?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Tara."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Tara, so nice to meet you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Nice to meet you, too."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Red brick by the door.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Bye."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. See you!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Then runs back and goes, "Dad, dad, dad," and starts taking the copper and puts it in his hand and he's, like, "Oh, that's a fine job." He pulls his hat up a bit and takes the coin. He looks over to you as you walk away and--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does he seem like a nice dad?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an insight check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh, that's good. 22

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Seems like a nice enough dad. Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Happy Father's Day.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anything else you guys wish to do? It's starting to get relatively close to that hour window.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you want many of them? Because I just bought a bunch.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll take two, then. Yep.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Flowers?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, please.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Flower?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: One, please.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Flower?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are there any authorities walking the street? Any crownsguard or kingsguard or--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are crownsguard. It's interesting, because there are half and half. For the large gnomish population here, you see half of the crownsguard are gnomish, and many of them have some form of firearm slung over their back and shoulders. The other half appear to be human or half-elf. The human/half-elf crownsguard appear to be less jovial and really paying attention to the chaos and generally trying to keep an eye out for anything untoward.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just like sentry, though. They're not concerned or turgid or stiff?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In comparison to the rest of the people that are currently celebrating, yes. But even the gnomish crownsguard seem to be taking their job seriously, but they're still part of the event.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Among their folks?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Honestly, there's more crownsguard at night than you expected. When you came into the city, it didn't seem that heavily guarded, but now they're out in a pretty serious force. You gather probably a combination of there being wartime, or because the nature of what this city builds. As you're glancing out, on the outside of the ledge of this upper area, looking down, there are a number of torches out by where the construction yards are down below. Either people are working through the night down there, or there's a fairly heavy presence of crownsguard present around these partially-constructed devices and machines of war that you saw being worked on earlier in the day.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's some dedication.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That seems like a bit much, doesn't it?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Work ethic can choke you in that way. Well, it's about that time. Should we make our way back for whatever this is going to be?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I got what I needed. I'm ready.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just a second. Nott, come here for a moment.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, Caleb, what is it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are you going to dance?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, I think we're going to drink first.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think you should.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I do like to dance.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, you should try it. You should enjoy yourself, but make sure that either Jester or I ties your mask on very tightly, yeah?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should I do the spell that you told me, the disguising spell, before the dance?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I mean, it would not be a bad idea.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. I'll do that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All the same. Maybe stay away from direct light, you know? If you can stay a little bit away from it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, because the shadows won't match.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja, and some people are smart and it won't work.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. I will. But you'll keep an eye out in case anyone--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is exactly what I will do.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. Thank you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You should enjoy yourself.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll try. If you want to join us, you could just point and clap, off to the side. You don't have to dance. You can be there to, like--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You guys know that dancing is about spontaneity and you are planning this dance, like when this is going to happen, so hard.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am not dancing, so it is not really an issue.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let your heart go.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: When you're performing, you have to have specific moves.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They had planned-out moves that were really cool.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. Like choreography. That's what we're talking about here.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They kick someone in the face every time.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I like dancing to dance.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. We'll do choreography to the right and left, and you two be in the middle and just freestyle.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think that will work out well. Make sure you use your scarves, though.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you guys still have one of those wands?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What wands? The Wand of Smiles?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have that. I hit a random person with the Wand of Smiles as we walk by them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The gentleman who's selling the flower bands is sitting, already smiling, and goes--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That guy knows.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Here. I take off my belt ribbon and I tie it around your Wand of Smiles. Now you have a ribbon dancer of smiles.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ah!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How many charges does that thing have?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't remember.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's probably it for the day.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It recharges, right? Over time?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it has a few uses on it per day. You guys return to the Blushing Tankard Tavern. The music's still blaring. Drinks are being thrown around. A bunch of people are singing big, old songs and clanking their tankards together and spilling onto the tabletops. The floor is already slick with spilled liquor here and there. It is a party that hasn't stopped since you left. As you guys begin to enter, the dwarven woman who you had spoken with earlier gets onto one of the central tables and slams her foot on the table. Everyone starts looking over and she goes, "Attention, "arseholes! Might I have your leering eyes upon this supple and available specimen of a woman?" You hear some whistles. "Oh, thank you." She bends forward with a wink to the crowd. "It's as you've "all been waiting for: The Hour of Honor!" "Yeah!" Cheers, clapping. "The tokens and titles are at "stake. Ol' Blemmy and his crew hold this winner's tokens for the last three weeks," and she gestures over and you can see a team there, mostly of gnomes. Ol' Blemmy is this dwarf with one giant gash down his face, and the snow-blind eye in that socket is sitting there with this tuft of a beard that has been so unkempt that you can't see his mouth. It's this gray-black, salt-and-pepper bush that disappears into a chin beard. You assume he's grinning beneath there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Like Bread Papa?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Kind of, yeah. Beard Papa?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, it's all Beard Papa.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They're not willing to let them go! Who wants to put up their coin and their balls to "topple these nobodies?" (chuckling) Folks start standing up and tossing some coin on the table at her feet and shouting out, "Five silver!" "A gold piece!" "Three gold over here!" People are standing up and their groups are starting to get amped up and ready. She's like, "Keep them coming, "keep them coming!"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ten gold?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ten gold.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Whoa. By the colorful newcomers-- hi there, sweetie!"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh god.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're sitting there with elements of their leather work clothes still on, and they're all thinking and talking amongst themselves, and they all pull in a few more coins, and one of them comes forward, still wearing leather gloves from the day and pops down, "15 gold."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hmm, shit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 20 gold!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He goes back, talking to them. Comes back, "25 gold pieces."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, come on! I don't even know if I want to do that for 20 gold.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I just don't know how to walk away from something like this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 25 and five silver!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So petty.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh for god's sake, 30 gold.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Price is right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At that point, everyone goes, "Whoa!" With a flourish, you place the rest of the 30 gold piece pot on the table. "Ooh."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So you'll all be giving me a little bit of gold for this later.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "So?" Turns back and looks back at the miners, and they all go (heavy sigh).

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'll be out of town in a week.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They gather their gold off the table back again, and Irena goes, "Well, if that's it, it "looks like our contenders for the night are-- (quietly) what are you called?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The Mighty Nein.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The Mighty Nein!"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If I want to be known for something, this is exactly what I want to be known for.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right, let's set up these drinks people!" With that final slam on the table, she leaps off onto the ground and starts heading off towards the bar on the side. The other bartender-- the gnomish gentleman there is rapidly clearing out tankards and drinks, and he's starting to pull up bottles onto the countertop. They start pushing tables into the center again once more as the crowds begin to circle around, and Ol' Blemmy and the rest of his rather rough-looking crew that have seen some life in their time--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fraternity all-stars.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're all pretty much gnomish middle-age, which could be anywhere between 100 to 200 years old, and you can see the weathering on their faces and their clothing. They look like they nearly drink professionally. They step up to the table and they figure out what order they're going to go in. You guys figure out what order you're going to go in?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are we all going?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Anybody who wants in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's five on their team, and talking to her a bit, she goes, "All right, there's five competitors. You need to pick five of your team to compete."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Who's the worst at drinking?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, I've never been drunk.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Then maybe you should sit this one out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But maybe I'm really good at it, you don't know!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do we want this to be the thing that we find out on?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Probably not, Jester.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Caleb, how're you feeling?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't think I should go late in the game, but I feel capable of this challenge.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Excellent.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I can drink.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm pretty good at it, too.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm ready for this.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I've never had a drink in my life.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Our fucking team captain over here!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Who's sitting it out amongst you guys?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I guess it will be me.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, we need five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You need five, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We have eins, zwei, drei, vier, und fünf.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe you can be--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm taking my five gold back from him, and I'm stomping upstairs.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You could be the manager of the team!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You can also drink along since we'll have to buy your drinks for you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can also give you some magic mushrooms if you want to slip them in their drinks.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's fungus, actually.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, but I can work distraction.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes. You can use your clerical mysticism to confuse and disrupt our enemy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I stomp back down the stairs, and I join them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you're coming down, you notice, Jester, the crowds are all gathering, and there's this big circle appearing around the central-- they have two tables that are set up with a single bench each end. You can see a third table behind it where there's probably going to be the dwarf woman overseeing this venture. You do see this little gnome girl that's walking through the crowd, and her hands open, and people are--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it Tara?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's not Tara, actually, but it's a rather dirty-looking gnome little girl who's thumbing through and getting pushed around a little bit, her hands are out in front.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I give her a little money. I give her a silver.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She takes it and, "Thank you," barely audible voice, and continues wandering in the crowd. So, the five of you guys are doing it?

lines.name: SAM, TALIESIN, TRAVIS, MARISHA, LIAM
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He sits up, gets on one end of the table, puts one hand on his tankard, and is waiting for his competitor. "And on The Mighty Nein's side, who's competing against old Duncan?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're our ringer.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. So I'll wait until there's--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Molly, do you want to kick us off?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll take this in. I'm going to Riker right over the chair and sit down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What's your name?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Molly, dear.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Molly! All right. So we'll take turns." She grabs this small barrel-- it's a handheld barrel-- she pours both of your drinks to the brim. "When I clap hands together, you both drink! It's not "first to finish, but it's one drink after the next. First to pass out or lose their drink "forfeits. So with your drinks full, let's begin!" With that, I need you to roll a constitution check. Roll a d20, add your constitution modifier.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Warm it up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch as Duncan, takes it (gulping).

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No wait, add your constitution. 12!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, 12, sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're drinking it and getting through it fine. You're partway through your drink and he's already finished (slam) on the table. It was a natural 20 on his end.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You finish the drink, and you're like (burp), a little effervescent, but it's there. So that's one loss on your end. How the rules work is that the first to three losses is the one-- in these competitive spaces.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So you have to drink fast? I thought you just said it didn't matter how fast--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, that was just how fast he finished. The idea is you both make competitive constitution checks and the first to three losses in that competition is the one that either barfs or passes out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Barf saves.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Copy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Come on, Molly.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ugh, goddamn it. Eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He rolled a two plus two, so, four.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This time around, you manage to finish a little sooner than him. You put it down; he's like (burp, then chuckling). Roll again. Fills up for the third round.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You finish your drink a little bit sooner than him, plop it down. (burping, grunting) From behind him you hear Ol' Blemmy go, "Don't you lose it, boy!" A voice that grates like it's been slammed across a hundred years of seawater.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Molly, how is it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's rough.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll off again.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You finish your drink. He takes his next one, pops it down, and you both stare for a moment. (coughing and spitting) Down the front of his shirt, the crowd's goes like, "No!" Tries to scoop it back up, and they're like, "No, and you're out!" Irena kicks him out of the chair, "And he's done! First round goes to The Mighty Nein!"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, shit!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He gets off the ground, dazed. You are fucking drunk, Molly.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm very drunk.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This woman has seen some shit and lived. She gets up to the side, takes the same tankard, and goes, "I'll show you how it's done, Duncan. Fill it!"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: She's got nothing on you. She's nothing! You got this!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: My resting bitch face is stronger! And I jump in.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I hop up on the table next to her and start yelling: Beau! Beau!

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Beau! Beau!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I use Thaumaturgy to make it sound like other people are chanting with me.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, girl, yes!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's a roll.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's a 21!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With that, the crowd starts picking up on Beau, and the name, "Beau! Beau! Beau!" begins to resonate through the crowd. You lock eyes with this gnomish woman and you can see there should be color, but the irises are gray-- slate gray-- and it puts you off. There's this intensity to her that you're like, "Oh. This is--"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fjord, she has crazy eye.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do I have advantage because people are chanting my name?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. But people are definitely invested in this victory. Go ahead and make your first roll.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Don't fuck me, Gil. 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You both chug, slam it down at the same exact time. Both hold tight. It was a tie.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh no, you're getting shithoused during this round!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I am!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They fill up the drinks. "And next round, go!" Roll for it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Blue die. Okay! 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You both (gulping)-- you finish just before, slam the drinks down. (heavy exhaling)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm not as tough as Beau.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's one victory on your end there. Roll again.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Snap.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fuck. Seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a loss on your end.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Burns your eyes a little bit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Next one.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You got this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Don't fuck me, Gil. I'm going to let it go, I'm going to let it live, 19. No, 20! No, 17, 18, 19! I know math.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nice rolls! These are not saving throws, right? This is the actual check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Plus three.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Got it. On that, as you both fill this next set of tankards, you drink, and you finish just before she does. Both slam down, and she's starting to have to tough into it. You can see her grinding her fingers into the woodwork. This is a lot of drinking.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I wipe the sweat off with my robe.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's two victories to you, one victory to her. Fill up the next batch, the crowd's still shouting, "Beau! Beau! Beau!" Next roll.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This time she toughs it in, she grabs with both hands and chugs it down. The foam catches the corner of her mouth and she finishes it and she wipes it off and sips it off her finger.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Brutal.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a victory on her end. You guys are both tied, the next roll's going to see who takes it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Win or go home, Beau. Eye on the Cobalt Soul, here we go!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Beau! Beau! Beau!" Her left eye's twitching as she's glaring at you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right, Gil. Comes down to you, boy.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Come on, Beauregard.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did she already roll?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She did.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (frustrated noise) Six. No, five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With that, you both chug, maintaining eye contact. You get partway into it, and then (coughing and retching) and you begin backing up into the tankard. You try and pass it off, and then as you drop the tankard to gather yourself, (spitting) it sprays onto the table.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh!" The whole crowd worked up for Beau's victory falls into a series of sad awws. Ruth finishes her drink, sets it on the table and (teeth sucking) turns around and goes back.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm sure we've got bread around here somewhere, just find something to soak all of that up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ugh. Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Next up, we have Valkin!" You see now, this very young-- looks like the runt of his family line of gnomes-- comes forward. Looks very thin, bright-eyed, and very stark contrast to the rest of them, as he gets closer to the table and sits down. "Who's my competitor?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Puts out a hand, "Caleb, it's a pleasure."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a pleasure.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Best of luck. May the best gnome win."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's enjoy a good game. Did you just say, "May the best gnome win?"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's trash talking! Don't listen to him!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Keep him out of your head!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am a very skinny man. Let's do this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: High metabolism. Use it!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do not let me fall asleep face down in the gutter tonight.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Won't happen.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That was an option?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: For you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys gather, the crowd begins to pull in a bit. The evening mistress leans down at you and goes, "Don't worry lad. I can see you're nervous, but just let the throat open and take it "in." Leans back, "And first batch, go!" Roll off.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Grog die! Yes! 21!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh shit! Unexpectedly so, little Caleb finds his taste for alcohol in this one, and with but a moment's notice, downs the entirety of his glass, finishing it before Valkin does. Who says, "Oh, "well done. That's impressive."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, it's a good game. It's just a game.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fills both of them again. Next round, go for it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So polite.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wann woll-

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your confidence overtakes you as you go into the second round of cups, and you manage to finish, but you have to stop halfway through. You have to actually go (heavy breathing) for the second serving. You take it down and finish it; however, as you pull your glass down, you can see Valkin's there, leaning.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Enjoying the fumes. As they waft up again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I can tell that. Well done, well done."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe we should do our dance to distract his competitor now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's a good idea.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Their drinks are filled. Go for it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Directly in front of Valkin, we start-- (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both of you guys make individual performance checks.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It was 15, but 12.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He does not seem to be distracted, unfortunately. What did you roll?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 13 for me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you take a moment and (grunting and huffing)--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nighty Mein never says die!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You manage to finish the last bits of it, and it takes a moment. You can feel all the suds of the mixtures of drinks you've had tonight billowing in your stomach and churning. You hear the (gurgling) in your stomach. You're like, oh that's not good. That's a second loss on your end.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh no! No, Caleb, no!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I feel like it might go out the back exit instead of the front.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They fill it up. Next roll.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You got this? I got this."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Caleb, steady.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I swat him on the side of the face.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, don't! Don't touch."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I do it again. It's good!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Ah no! Don't do it please!"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's good for you! Drink!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fill up the last batch. You guys both, final roll.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Natural 13 on his end. With that, he finishes the drink and goes, "Told you! Boo yah!" Gets up from the table, turns around, and (thud) faceplants right in the ground. Crowd goes, "Yeah! "Caleb!" Pick him up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I nod, cooly, for a second, and I just turn and go (spitting).

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Second to last competitor, the powerhouse, The "Walking Brick herself, Tanya!" This dwarven woman, who looks like Rosie the Riveter on steroids, comes around the corner. She has her sleeves rolled up past the deltoids. She has these massive hands with a bit of the dwarven hair gathered on the outside of the forearm. Big, square jaw, missing the two front teeth, and she grins as she sits down. She has most of her hair up and tied into this cloth. She got a bit of the coal smears on her cheeks.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah Tanya! Woo!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay. I'll throw my leg over the chair and sit down. Evening.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, Fjord!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Ah. Evening to you."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I like Tanya!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You ever done this before?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, like all the time. You?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, good luck then. I'm happy to see how long you last, big boy. Fill it up!" They fill the drinks. Take your first swig there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You both finish neck and neck, but you still manage to get it down faster. As you both stand there, she looks at you with a nod of being impressed. "Not bad, not bad."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is that all there is to this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, we've just gotten started."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fill her up!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Fill her up!" Fill the next round.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nott, she said you were bad!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She beats you with a 16. As she goes ahead and finishes off, sets it down and just waits for you to finish, fingers crossed, and goes, "Cute, cute. Not as strong as coming out of the gate. Is "that all you got? You going to lose the wind in your sails there, green boy?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I admit, I feel a little weak. I can't tell if it's the drink or if it's your beautiful visage sitting in front of me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear this voice go, "Ah, ey ey! He's mine."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shit. Fill her up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They fill up the two drinks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to cast Mirror Image on myself in front of... her. What's her name?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Tanya.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Tanya, and wiggle to make it look like her vision's starting to double.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a deception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Eight!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eight. You manage to do so. She doesn't seem to be paying attention to you. Caleb, you're getting really nauseous watching Jester do this little dance off to the side.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Whoa-oa-oa.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make your roll.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No shit! Okay!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is one smooth seaman.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's more where that came from! Fill it up! I "got his number, come on!" Make a roll off.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What the shit!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fucking champ!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Eye contact never broken!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And with that, Tanya goes down. She gets halfway through the drink before, "No. Sorry," and looks back towards Ol' Blemmy before she leans forward and stumbles out of the chair. One of the other people picks her up and pulls her to the side, and Ol' Blemmy's just sitting there, fuming.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Never get into a drinking game with a man of the sea.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She goes, "And with that, it looks like Ol' Blemmy's team has fallen! That's three victories-- " at which, Ol' Blemmy puts up a hand and goes, "Not yet! I haven't competed. One of theirs hasn't "competed. How 'bout we make a deal? Last fight: double or nothing."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, we can win money from this thing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It was always about money.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I thought we only got tokens or something for free drinks.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nah, we win money. There's money in it. I like it. I say we go for it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I like it as well, but only if you can match this diamond worth, oh... about 100 gold.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you putting in the f-- well.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Give me something like that or there's no deal.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They look at each other going, "I think that's a little rich for our tastes."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Aw, no, fuck it! Let's just do it without that deal! Double or nothing! Go Nott! Yeah!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She's the worst negotiator ever!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is such a change of pace from last year. It's so exciting.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All my mirror images are like, yeah! Drink!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Who's going to come after me then?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm scared.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You've got it Nott!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. I've looked in the-- by the way, Matt-- I've looked in the thing. The--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The dodecahedron.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The dodecahedron.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, I'll try. Hello, sir.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This? This is what you bring before me as an offering?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (hiccups)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm going to crush you, little green one."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fuck his shit up, Nott! Fuck his shit up!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, I'll try!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you under Disguise Self?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's great. When he talks, you see the bristles of the beard-- You can see as the evening mistress up at the top goes, "All right! Looks like we're going to get to see Ol' Blemmy strain "through his baleen after all! Get to the sides of the table. Let The Whale take a drink."

lines.name: MARISHA, TRAVIS
lines.text: The Whale?!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh shit!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't have this.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You already have this!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Bottomless pit!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The dwarf sits down. His mitt completely encompasses the tankard with his giant dwarven hand. "Against Ol' Blemmy we have?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (stammering) Hello. I'm Otto.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Otto!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Woo!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Otto the Bottomless Pit!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "And drink!" Pours the drinks, make a roll.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a five.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You could use it now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you going to go with it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That was a victory on your end.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I feel good. This feels right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Otto!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Get it, von Bismarck!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Next batch. Make the roll.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's an 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18? That's pretty damn good. Ol' Blemmy finishes his drink. That's two for two victories on your end there. He's not had the best luck rolling these last two rounds. He finishes it down, "You're small, but I can see why they call you the Bottomless Pit."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, BP!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He grabs the barrel from the person and fills his own last tankard, hands it off. "Let's "go." Take the roll.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I drink this with Mage Hand pouring from way up there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you really want to, sure.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you're like, "Ah!" catching it underneath. The crowds like, "Yeah!" clamoring. Go ahead and make your roll.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Only 14.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As it's coming down, it's splashing on your face a bit. You're trying to catch it all.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I got too cocky!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You manage to catch most of it and you finish it. You realize that the liquors that you've been having are not been mixing well with this particular drink. You're starting to feel-- oof. That's a victory on his end.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh no!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll for the next one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't think I can do it!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Jester cut him! He can't see you out there, cut him!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Cut my eyes! Cut my eyelids off!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What? No! You got this, Nott! I'm going to cast Bless.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, what does that do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think it gives you advantage on saving throws. Is this a saving throw?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, but you're blessed.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But I cast it on you!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, make your roll.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's a 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: TRAVIS, MARISHA
lines.text: (chanting) Break the tank! Break the tank!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you both finish the drink, everyone is like, "Yeah! Oh--" The whole crowd backs up for a minute.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nott!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Irena leans does and fiddles through his pockets and pulls out his token. He goes, "I do "believe that you've earned this!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (drunkenly) And we get our names on the board!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What does this get me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, it get you free drinks here for the rest of the week. Or until someone takes it from you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Free drinks?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Guys, we can drink more!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (drunkenly) Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (drunkenly) Yep.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You guys look like shit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's three of you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There are, yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: My mouth is watering.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let it be known that The Mighty Nein can take on any competitor and win! Victory will be ours in any arena!

lines.name: MATT

lines.text: "I can see you're newcomers to the town, then."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Indeed. So much so that we seem to have been relieved of our coin during last night's revelry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You don't say."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Does that happen a lot around here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "To conspicuous folks? Maybe. It happens every now and then, we try and keep an eye out "there. As with any place of business, there is always going to be some element of theft. Nothing "we saw out of the ordinary, but we can begin to investigate if you like."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well that might not be necessary. I believe it was our fault. But just out of curiosity, is there anywhere in town that, I don't know, there might be an infestation of this sort of problem? Do you know any common areas where folks engaged in this sort of activity might gather at night or in the day? Areas of trouble that you've dealt with before-- oh god, am I sweating?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You are, profusely. I can't say there's a specific region. If anything, the workplaces here "are not teeming with that element. The industrious nature of the city keeps itself busy in a very "visible place. Perhaps, somewhat here in the Idleworks Shelf, there's the residential areas of "Silver Falls. Those are probably the more likely areas. I wouldn't look in the lower half. Up here "in this shelf and beyond would probably be the most-- Are you sure? I don't mind, I could "probably keep an eye out. Is there any information you have about these individuals who robbed you may be?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (sighs) We're a little light on details, unfortunately. You know what, I'm going to go eat a half a cow, and then maybe once that's soaked up some of this I'll return. If I remember anything else.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah, I think you should go do that."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right, thank you, have a good morning.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You too." He sits back into his post, looking a bit confused.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ask Irena about the little girl.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Irena, what about the little girl?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which little girl?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's a little girl that was walking around last night that was asking for money and stuff.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh yeah, the beggar. She comes in every now and then. Some folks help her get along."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She doesn't steal things?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What're you talking about?" Make an insight check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is she lying to me? Does she know more? 12.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, as best as you can read she seems to be forthright. As best as you can read.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to cast Zone of Truth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So what's the saving throw on that? What's the DC?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I like it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Charisma...

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Cut to the fucking chase!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Trim the fat!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, she fails. She goes like, "What's going on?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What are you talking about?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because if I recall, yeah, she is aware of the spell. She's like, "What sort of trickery are "you doing here? I don't like this. I'll ask you to leave."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I don't think you need to do that. I'm just, you know, curious about what happened last night, if you have ever seen any shady figures in here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There are many shady figures that come through here. It's a town."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (cooing) More specific!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you know of anyone who would've stolen coins from people?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Who was here last night?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know you're asking me-- Look, I'm a "shady-looking character sometimes as well. I can't pick it. There's a lot of hard-working people here."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you steal the money?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I did not steal your money!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm just checking. Do you know who stole our money?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, I don't know who stole your money!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey Rissa, come here for a second!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: But if you were going to suspect somebody, who would it be?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't know. You damn well pissed off Ol' Blemmy. He's a possible one. Otherwise, I don't "know if anyone got too friendly with you last night. I mean you've got to get close to take your money."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Was anyone friendly with you guys?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Not with me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I didn't send any people up to your rooms, because you told me not to pay for-- I was holding "your cash, which I've still got by the way. And the offer still stands. But--"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is there a thieves' guild?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't know, probably."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Rissa, come here!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Rissa comes up. "I can help you?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Irena, if Molly was interested, would you like--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Snip his--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, just like--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't understand what you're trying to imply here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nevermind, let's go to Rissa.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No seriously though, what was this? Why is this having sex?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't you guys use scissors when you have sex with each other?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is this a goblin thing?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This might be a goblin thing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is real.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Stop it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's simple.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Rissa! Do you know of anyone who steals money from drunk people?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Not personally. I'm sure there are folks out there."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you see anyone taking our friends' money last night?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She rubs her temples and you can tell she is a little hungover herself, too. She's like, "No..."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Did those two gentlemen come back into the bar at any point?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fitz and Ashton.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh, good call.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I saw them come in at one point, but then leave when they noticed I was still hanging with "you folks, so thank you for that. I appreciate that."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I mean, at the very least that'll be fun.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Man. Do we have any other questions to ask? Who are you all attracted to. Do you guys like me?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's what I was trying to get to. Wait, us? We have to answer truthfully?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, because you were standing next to me anyway.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If you're within 15 feet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're not my type.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If all the rest of you are in the area?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Everybody's my type. I'm really pretty easy.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I was at the door. I don't know how big the place is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If anybody else steps into that zone, you have to make a saving throw.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I was going to do something before Jester did what she did.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What was your question?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Who are you attracted to? Do you like me? Are we friends? Do you really like me and stuff?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a saving throw.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wow, that was a layer of questions.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I like you. You're nice.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Charisma, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What is it, charisma saving throw? 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you resist it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Has there been a raise in criminal activity? Is there something in the town that would start provoking people to want to pickpocket more? Is the rise in the war effort bringing people down? There's got to be some reason.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Rissa goes, "I mean, it's possible, I imagine. People are distracted. They're working "hard. They're having to push out double time in a lot of their work to get things out to the front "lines. It's possible."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Whoever took our purses has our drink tokens too.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They do have our drink tokens. That was in the bag.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You didn't need to remind her, she's ready to pop as it is, all right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm just saying that if drink tokens come back to the bar--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Then you know. (gasps)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I wouldn't come back the next night if it were me. I would want to make sure that we were gone.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: But somebody's got them.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How could they even use them? Because only the winners that everyone saw won them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They're just one drink. They would keep all the hundreds of gold.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I would keep it, though.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's what I was thinking.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. Because it probably blends in. Are they the same sort of shape as regular coins?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They are, but they're wooden and a little bit bigger than an actual gold coin.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Anytime I've stolen something I couldn't use later I've always kept it for sentimental reasons. I'm not sure why.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, it's a prize. It's a reminder of your good job.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's smart. Should I cast it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sometimes--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hang on. Irena.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes? What you asking?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you have any new staff members?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, it's just me and Syd." At this point Syd brings out the last of the food, the male gnome who you saw when you first entered. He's like, "So, all of your food is ready. Enjoy."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You mentioned being able to get us friends and other type of services. Where do you find those resources?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Through a friend of mine."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What's her name?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Why are you asking me all these questions? I didn't send anyone up to your room, "and I'm not going to spill all of my business propositions your direction."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I just think you might know who did. Even if you don't consciously know, I think you have an idea.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Not really, lass."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She's telling the truth.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you give a shit about our problems?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Rissa, do you know where this Ashton and Fitz stay?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She nods and takes another sip of her morning coffee, and goes, "Aye, they're about two "blocks down from my father's... shack. A couple of kids that-- although at this hour they're probably "working at the anvil."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If I wanted to go hock some stolen goods, where would I go?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't know. I haven't hocked stolen goods around here. I'm sorry."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: One more question!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To which one? You have both Rissa--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Irena. Where does the pianist live?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What, of the band?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, the guy playing the piano.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Here! He has a room on the third floor."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, maybe if I cast Locate Object we'll find out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's his name? We never asked.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He was really talented, though. I mean, like, super duper.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He was Weimar.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Weimar.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He had to flip a page for that one. It was exciting.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why don't we start by going around where Fitz and Ashton lived and then maybe we can pay a little visit to Rissa's pops?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, she said they lived by her pops' place.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, we'll go and I'll cast Locate Object and maybe we'll just pass by something.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I wanted to meet Pops anyway. He sounds interesting.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's like, "Oh, all right. Fair warning-- pardon me, rough morning."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We feel that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "So where are you wanting, are you looking for the boys? The Steelbringer's Forge first, or "going to my pop's place?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'll go to your father's place first. I think we'll maybe, if we're in the mood, pop into their place while they're not home, perhaps.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Who? What, the Fitz and that guy?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay, follow me." She gets up and finishes her coffee, sets it back down, and you guys take whatever scraps remain of your breakfast and make your way back out into the street.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pocket bacon! Before we leave, I ask Irena, who's still in the Zone of Truth, are you really interested in Fjord or are you just flirting with him because it makes you some money and stuff?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Both? I'm a businesswoman, but I've got my needs."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. Okay. Thank you. I cast Locate Object on the coins.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Already? We're not there yet. Now? Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It lasts for ten minutes. What if it's in the tavern still?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Makes sense.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're not getting anything.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's run!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going to put you on a cart, and we're going to take the cart.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel like we'll walk faster than the cart will go.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Will we walk faster than the cart will go?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In the town, getting the cart around can be a bit of a pain. It's comparable, but you also have to deal with a cart.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's walk quickly!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see it has a roof that is metal sheets. There is a smokestack on top that's giving out this lazy smoke drip that makes its way into the sky, and a sign out front that says "Tinkertop Inventions."

lines.name: MARISHA, LAURA
lines.text: Aw!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: When we get there after our run, I chuck up a little salsa into the back of my throat and swallow it down.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Really? All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She goes (sighs). Rissa rolls her eyes, and knocks on the metallic door. "Yes? Come in." "Dad, "it's me. I have some friends here, they just want to say hi. They got thieved." "Oh, that's all "right, come on in, certainly!" (sighs) She opens the door, and on the inside, you already hear the whirring of hundreds of tiny clockwork objects. On the inside, you can see, wall to wall, clocks of all sizes. Some broken, springs exposed. Some that are fixed, and clicking away. Some that have small sculptures that move in a circle around a central area. You can see partially made pulleys, small toys that are set up on the corner, some wooden, some metal, and all of them have some sort of built-in clockwork locomotion to them, though they are currently still. There are two sets of lanterns that are hanging in the back, giving the faint light which is, as you enter, giving this dark silhouette to a lot of these objects, but as you walk into the light and look behind you, you can see the detail work in them, and they're very beautiful and very well-made. It's at that point you hear a (crash) "Ah! Ugh!" You glance over and you can see, hopping up and down, running his hand like this, this older gnome character with patches of white-gray hair, this big bush of a white beard. It's well-trimmed up here and then comes to a point at the bottom. Very large spectacles with a number of smaller and even smaller lenses in the front of it. He's currently wearing a leather apron and sleeves that are rolled up, and one of his hands is currently now bleeding on the edge and he's like (distressed noises). "I'm terribly sorry about that! Come forward! She said you're "the friends of my lass there. How are you doing? What's your names?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Morning. We're The Mighty Nein. We had the pleasure of meeting your daughter yesterday. She showed us a great time last night.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, did you, dear? That's so nice! You're making friends." Rissa's like, "Dad, please stop "it. Look, they just wanted to come by, they had some questions, I think. Do what you're going to "do, please, so we get going."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How close are we to the other houses at this point? To the boys?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Probably not within a thousand feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The boys, she mentioned earlier, are a few blocks down, or a few buildings down and up from where you are. "Well, at the very least let me introduce myself! I'm Mastermaker Cleff Tinkertop!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Cleff or Cliff?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Cleff."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was excited to see what sort of stuff--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Creator and experimenter of all things metallic and clicking!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Your shop is beautiful!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Thank you so much! I appreciate that! So yeah, what can I do for you?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you have any little toys that Kiri would like?"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What's--?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Kiri's our little daughter, she's a bird."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Kiri is right here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You look over and Yasha's still behind. Kiri (chirping). He's like, "That's a mighty big bird!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She's a little girl.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She leans forward, looks up to him. (like Cleff) "She's a mighty big bird!" He's like, "That's a nice trick on that one! I like that."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She's very talented.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Do you like--" and he pulls this small contraption, it's actually a miniature version of what you saw those large bolt throwers that were constructed out front, where it has this bowed arc and there's a small, blunted stick in it. He goes, "All you do is pull back on this trigger." Ping! It fires off, narrowly missing the side of Beau's head, hits something, and you hear glass shatter in the background and he goes, "Oh, maybe not that one." Puts it back. (cranking) And hands something over to Kiri, who accepts it. There's a moment where things are awkward and there's a tension, and you're about to go-- before it opens up and from the inside you see this tiny metallic bird, its wings flap up and down. A music box begins to play (metallic song) and Kiri, looking at this, begins mimicking exactly the sound of the music box (metallic song). It's almost one beat behind it, until it synchronizes, and she's mimicking at such an incredibly fast pace behind it that they're almost in unison, until eventually it slows down and comes to a stop. Kiri looks back to you (chirping).

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you like it? How much is that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, that one, it's a beautiful piece. I'll be happy to let it go for about three gold pieces."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Three gold pieces. I think that's worth it, Kiri. Okay. Three gold pieces.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Some that look like they could be armaments, almost. Some that look like they're the insides of larger machine pieces.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What's the thing you're most proud of?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Ah, proud of, now? I have one thing I'm working on, if you want to see it."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, absolutely!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's like a half-clockwork, gear-based crank hand crossbow.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: A repeating crossbow.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's a repeating crossbow.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How does it work?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, you lower the bolt into here, and you crank it back real fast," and it's like (squeaking) as he cranks it, "I probably have to oil this. Crank it. Then, you just release!" This one goes, just parting Caleb's hair, into the roof above.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How many gold is that toy?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, this one, you see, I had a friend of mine go ahead and help prepare it "with some magical enchantment."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (distorted) Whoa!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What the fuck was that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know, it sounded like a cow, or like a manatee was at the table, I don't know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I call this one The Tinkertop Boltblaster 1000."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Whoa!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What happened to the other 999?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How much is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This one runs just over 2000 gold."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Whoa, that is a lot of gold.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, it's my prototype, so if I'm going to let it go..."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Am I allowed to rob him?

lines.name: MARISHA, TALIESIN
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Rissa's like, "Dad, they don't want it, it's fine. No one wants all your bullshit, please."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's not true, it actually is quite impressive.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You wouldn't say that if you'd known what some of his other things have done." He gets quiet for a second and recoils, quietly hurt. He goes, "It comes with the job sometimes. Not everything "works out like you hope."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You said you'd lost some favor with people in power. I don't mean to pry, but would you mind sharing what happened?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Uh--" and Rissa's like, "Ah, it's-- you don't have to answer him. We can go find the "boys." "It's all right." Make a persuasion check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Come on. Shamone! Oh, yeah, that's a 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20? You see his trepidation there, and he goes, "You look like you've got an honest face, "so: I was working on a job here for the wardens of the Gearhold Prison down below. I was helping them "and came up with, at their request, what would be a clockwork warden. Something that could help keep "watch over some of the more dangerous and difficult inmates of the prison below. And I did "it. I was very proud of it. On its first foray, it had some faults I didn't see coming, and we "couldn't control it. It began to just destroy whatever was in its way."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are you speaking of an automaton?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "More or less."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did it kill people?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They tell me. They keep it down there still. They've sealed it off and it's been "there for the better part of two years and every now then, they like to remind me. I didn't mean "anything bad by it. I was just doing my job and I thought I was very proud of my work. I didn't see "the problems there. I was just trying to help."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How do they remind you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They come by and tell me."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are there punishments levied against you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Thankfully, not many. I'm still paying off my fine. They were going to try and destroy the "thing, but unfortunately they've had to allocate their attention to many places, and now with the "war coming, I don't know if they'll ever get to it. But as long as it's down there, it's a black "spot on my name, and her name." Rissa goes, "Dad, just please stop it."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We could destroy it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or get it back for you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And then you could give us the crossbow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't want to send any more people to their death, at the very least."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're really strong.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, we're kind of death-adverse.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Plus, we would love to pay for your crossbow, but we're currently light.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fuck, we're broke.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All of our money was stolen. All of their money was stolen. I was sober.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Good for you."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "A learned lesson for the rest of you."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was a choice, you know. Everybody else was like, "Let's get drunk!" and I was like, "That "is really bad and I should probably stay sober."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm very proud of you. I mean, that sounds very kind of folks that wandered in here naught "but a few moments ago."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What would you do if you had the thing back, or--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, I don't want it back, I just want it gone. I want it destroyed, I want it taken care of "and buried. I don't want to touch it."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, who wandered in here before?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, he was just talking about us. You're still drunk, aren't you?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you afraid this clockwork warden could be used for malign purposes?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't think it could be used for anything but just killing what's in front of it right now."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So they have it penned in, but it is out of their control?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "From what I know. You'd have to go ask the Wardenhelm. I don't go down there places. I mean, "I can't expect you to do something like that. It's very sweet of you to offer."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Seems to have caught the eye of most of our group.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I mean, in a theoretical space, which is where I live most of my days, if you were to put "this blight to rest, I'd be happy to give this to you free of charge and my thanks."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We will take it under consideration.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And, just while we're talking, you wouldn't happen to know of any criminal undergrounds, thieves' guilds, pickpocketers, people of the night?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't--"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Roamers of shadows?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't delve in those places. I'm sorry."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Vampires, zombies?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't know what's going on!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's okay. Calm down.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Cleff, do you also have simple arms?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I deal with more detailed arms. If you're looking for simple, you're probably going to go to "the Steelbringer's Forge." Rissa goes, "That's where the boys will probably be. That's where they work."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Probably heading that way anyway. The anvil.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Cleff, you know, you seem to have a fine eye and talent for mechanical devices.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Thank you very much."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you ever have any need of alchemical combinations with your mechanical devices?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm always looking for fine oils. Clockwork tends to need to be lubricated."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: As a sign of good faith. Didn't we get oil at some point?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't think so.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I threw mine at a troll.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait. Oh, wait, no. I have holy water. That is not the same thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's okay. If you come across some oil, I could use it."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Rissa. I like your friends." She's like, "Thank you, Dad."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You raised her good. She's been taking good care of us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Have you found work yet?" "No, Dad. I'm working on it."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Awkward.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She's working for us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right, I'm working for them."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: At the moment.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Good, good. Proud of you."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Subcontractor work isn't too bad of a living.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, no. It's still a living. That's more than some folks in the Empire can say."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I believe she's incorporated. She's incorporated.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, okay. Then we're fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Any good gnome is incorporated. I mean, that's a cultural thing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Fucking Hupperdook bureaucracy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay okay okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Cleff, we appreciate your time. We are going to venture out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course. I expect nothing. I really appreciate you being so kind. Good luck."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Our compliments on your work. It is truly spectacular.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Take care of my Rissania." She's like--

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Rissania!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There it is.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That was what I was hoping for, and it happened.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can see her shiver at the door and then just run out. "Goodbye! Take care!" (ping) Something shoots off. "Oh, damn it." As you all leave and exit out, she's out there fuming outside.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's adorable.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "He's something. He's certainly something."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: As we leave, I grab the bolt that he shot into the wall over Caleb's head.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You pocketed a bolt.

lines.name: MARISHA, TALIESIN, LIAM
lines.text: Pocket a bolt.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So Lasagna, should we try and find our way over to the--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Steelbringer's Forge?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right. Come on, I'll lead you over to where the boys are. You going to rough them up again?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They're only a couple blocks away?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right. Just right around the corner. Come on, I'll show you."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should I try casting it again?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wait a minute.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Not yet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: As we walk over there, I say: Hey, Rissa.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Aye."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You got a good dad. He really loves you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I know. He's just... he's difficult at times. It's hard to scrape under a family name "when it's been through the ringer."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sometimes family names aren't all that they're cracked up to be.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She gives you a look over. "I agree."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What's more important is that he really cares for you. Don't take that for granted, all right? And I slap her on the back and keep walking.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, and the fact that you know him is really cool, too. Anyway.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow, so many daddy issues.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I was going to say, me and Jester hold hands and we skip off.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you approach, you can already see the Steelbringer's Forge, which has a number of shields and swords on display, armor bits, and you can see simple tools are crafted here. As you step, already looking into the main chamber door-- which is open, because it's so hot in there, they have to keep a breeze going through-- there are two forges going at any given point in time. There are two anvils set up. You see a few gnomes at work and indeed, both Fitz and Ashton are both working as assistants. They're not actually banging the hammer, but they're both helping move things and quenching into the water and then helping gather materials and holding the metal and rotating it on the anvil as their bosses are hammering down. They don't seem to notice your arrival.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I use Thaumaturgy to make it sound like whispers of Infernal all around them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (hammering)

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: (speaking Infernal)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What beast brings their way into our workplace? Name yourself!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh hi!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They look at each other. The dwarf female goes (hammering) back to work. You see the two assistants look over and go-- and put their heads down and keep focused on their work. The gnome says, "Just take a break. Hi, can we help you?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're here to talk to those two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What did you do?" He slaps with a cloth, and the assistant's like, "Ah! I didn't-- gah!" "What did the boys do? What'd they do?"

lines.name: LAURA
